title: CSS Flexbox Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of CSS Flexbox layout properties and behavior

questions.question: What property makes an element a Flexbox container?
questions.explanation: display: flex — This property turns a container into a Flexbox, allowing its direct children to become flex items that respond to alignment, spacing, and direction rules.

questions.question: Which property controls horizontal alignment in a flex row?
questions.explanation: justify-content — In a flex container with flex-direction: row, justify-content determines how the items are spaced horizontally along the main axis.

questions.question: To make items stack vertically, you use:
questions.explanation: flex-direction: column — This changes the main axis from horizontal to vertical, making items stack one on top of the other.

questions.question: What does align-items: center; do?
choices: Vertically aligns items along the cross-axis
questions.explanation: Vertically aligns items along the cross-axis — In a row flex container, the cross-axis is vertical, so this centers all items vertically within the container.

questions.question: What property allows flex items to move to the next line?
questions.explanation: flex-wrap — This property allows items that exceed the container's width to wrap onto a new line instead of overflowing.
